alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Morgan, western Johnson, northern Magoffin and central Wolfe Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 659 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Adele, or 10 miles south of West Liberty, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Lewis, Lykins, Epson, Holliday, Hager, Well Station and Malone around 705 AM EDT. Bethanna, Harper, Patton, Wonnie, Kernie, Williams, Stella, Ova, Gullett and White Oak around 710 AM EDT. Bloomington, Elsie, Licksburg, Cisco, Gifford, Orient, Matthew, Florress and Lakesville around 715 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Salyersville, Mason, Coon, Perlie, Tella, Flat Fork, Cyrus, Quod, Plutarch, Ever, Wheelersburg, Hargis, Niles, Leatha, Minefork, Win, Brownlow, Lacey, Falcon, Mashfork, Oil Springs, Ballot, Elna, Redbush, Leander, Relief, Riceville, Dobson, Swamp Branch, Barnetts Creek, Staffordsville, Flatgap, Fitz, Denver, Collista, Barnrock, Patrick and Paintsville. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 46 and 76. U.S. Highway 23 in Johnson County between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
